content:
I have made some grammatical corrections to the English translation, and I added some stub generator code.

However, unless I'm missing something in the stub generator syntax, I don't think that you can have paired lines of input like you currently have it setup.  It also seems as though you can't have space-separated authors and a title with spaces in it on the same line.

So the stub generator that I wrote assumes that you will have [[N]] lines of just titles, followed by [[N]] lines of space-separated authors.

I have not updated the Input section to reflect this, though. I'm pretty sure you will need to somehow change the Input so that it will conform to something that the code generator can produce.
I'll upvote this challenge once everything is entirely in English, not merely translated (input and output descriptions as well).
This would probably get a few more reviews if it were in English, as is the rest of the site.
I added the english translation. But I feel this puzzle is maybe too complicated and not funny / interesting.
Sorry, I forgot that, this is fixed now.

Thank you very much for your help! However, there is sometimes more that 2 authors, so your stub cannot work, and I have troubles trying to fix it. It is like I need to add the numbers of authors for each paper to the inputs, and I need then to use each of these numbers to get each authors... I do not know if is is possible, it sounds complicated.

Okay. Yeah, you're right. Maybe it needs to just be something like:

loop N read title:string(256)
loop N read authors:string(256)

With the expectation that the user can figure out how to split the authors.

Whatever you decide, you will need to re-work the tests and validators a bit.
I updated the inputs and stub generator following your suggestion. Once again, thank you for your help!

It actually seems like a decent puzzle candidate to me now that I can read it. It's a pretty straightforward shortest path through a graph problem, which is a good problem for less experienced CodinGamers to be exposed to.

I'd honestly rather see more 'tough' community puzzles than there are now. There should be good variety.

It being funnier or a bit more interesting would be a big plus. But I don't know that that needs to be a prerequisite to a good challenge in my mind.
It's not complicated, it's just a BFS.
